citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
An adult, male domestic pig was observed to be missing large patches of hair on his sides and back, affecting about
about half of its body. The licensee stated that they suspect allergies and have tried a variety of treatments. The attending
veterinarian has not been consulted about the pig's hair loss and skin condition. Exhibitors must establish and maintain
programs of adequate veterinary care that include the use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat
diseases and injuries. Not obtaining proper veterinary care can prolong discomfort and cause unnecessary stress to the
animal. Correct by ensuring that a veterinarian evaluates the pig's condition and that all care instructions are being
followed.
***Correct by 4/18/25.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
An adult, male domestic pig was observed to be missing large patches of hair on his sides and back, affecting about 
about half of its body. The licensee stated that they suspect allergies and have tried a variety of treatments. The attending 
veterinarian has not been consulted about the pig's hair loss and skin condition. Exhibitors must establish and maintain 
programs of adequate veterinary care that include the use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat 
diseases and injuries. Not obtaining proper veterinary care can prolong discomfort and cause unnecessary stress to the 
animal. Correct by ensuring that a veterinarian evaluates the pig's condition and that all care instructions are being 
followed.  
 
***Correct by 4/18/25. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
